title: dplyr & tidyverse for data processing
questions: How can I load tabular data into R?
How can I slice and dice the data to ask questions?
objectives: Use dplyr and tidyverse functions to cleanup data.
key_points: Dplyr and tidyverse make it a lot easier to process data
The functions for selecting data are a lot easier to understand than R's built in alternatives.

contributors.name: Erasmus+ Programme
contributors.funding_statement: This project (2020-1-NL01-KA203-064717) is funded with the support of the Erasmus+ programme of the European Union. Their funding has supported a large number of tutorials within the GTN across a wide array of topics.

contributors.name: Avans Hogeschool
contributors.funding_statement: A number of our employees contribute directly to the Galaxy Training Network and seek to make our higher education learning materials more accessible to a wider audience through the GTN platform. avans.nl
